Headlines: The Integration Consultant's Guide for UKG Ready Integration Testing
Opportunity:
- Allow an IC to upload a workbook and output file. Compare the requirements with the results and share feedback. This is a proactive measure.
- Allow an IC to upload testing feedback from a carrier, which often comes in via email or a file (pdf, excel), and the test file that was sent. This is a reactive measure to help the IC move forward on a project.
- Based on the context shared above and an agent's knowledge of the Ready product and the context for the carrier, share the recommended next steps. The agent should be able to identify what is commonly a data issue vs. configuration issue vs. integration logic issue and try to guide the user in the right direction.
Evidence:
While testing integrations between UKG and third parties, there is often a lot of back-and-forth in the workflow:

- Send a test file
- Carrier reviews and shares feedback
- UKG reviews feedback, which could be related to data, configuration, and/or integration logic. Feedback is shared with the appropriate party to resolve, or internally resolved.
- Return to the start of this loop.

This can take many weeks or months for one project. Some carriers take weeks to reply, even if it turns out to be a small issue like an incorrect value in a header record, and the file could not be loaded. Clearly this can severely delay a project timeline.

We would save a lot of time with tools that support ICs during testing
BusinessValue:
This could reduce the timeline on integration projects by a number of weeks in many cases. Testing EDI is the most sensitive part of a project, as any small mistakes or key items missed during internal testing can lead to an extended timeline for customer/external testing (2+ weeks). A tool that can proactively test a file and align it with the requirements would add immense value to our ICs. The reactive testing would also help ICs digest feedback throughout testing, which will save at least an hour of testing time per project.

This idea can be used across all platforms, but it is important for an agent like this to have a degree of product knowledge catered to a given product, and understand carrier context to be successful.
AITheme: Intelligent Document Processing,Information Retrieval,Document Summarization,Conversational AI

Headlines: The Integration Consultant's Guide for UKG Ready Integration Assessments
Opportunity:
Integration Consultants will upload all details shared by customers & vendors during Integration Discovery. An AI agent should be instructed on the context including UKG Ready platform knowledge, internal tools like Integration Gateway & Jira, and Carrier knowledge. The agent will guide consultants through their assessment in a prescriptive way:

- IC uploads documents
- Agent assesses the details and identifies which integrations are needed
- Agent recommends key questions for the IC to ask on each integration
- IC shares the answers to each question, per integration
- Agent generates a requirements document based on these details, for each integration
Evidence: We have many integration tech stacks across UKG Ready, with hundreds+ of varying endpoints to send/receive data to/from. This creates many decision points from the start of Integration Discovery in implementation. We can use gen AI to support our consultants with these decisions, reducing the need to comb through requirements documents and simplifying this using context from our integration standards and thousands of prior projects in Jira. We spend a lot of time repeating tasks like creating workbooks for every integration in our current state.
BusinessValue: Save 2+ hours per integration assessment when a custom EDI is needed (no BenefitLink template available). Ready has built ~ 4500 of these in 2025, i.e. 9000 hours saved if we can reduce assesment time by 2 hours per integration.

UseCase: Automated Monitoring & Reporting of D365 Integration Data Management Batch Jobs
Headlines: AI-driven automation to monitor D365 Data Management batch jobs and send daily email reports with job status, failures, resolutions, and key execution detailsâ€”eliminating manual checks and improving integration reliability.
Opportunity:
Currently, monitoring integration batch jobs in D365 is a manual, time-consuming, error-prone process. Each day, teams must:
Navigate to D365 Data Management job history, Review all Oracle â†’ D365 sales order integrations (PSA, NA, ADP, etc.), Review Salesforce â†’ D365 customer integrations, Identify failures or partial successes, Troubleshoot errors and document resolutions, Compile and send a status email to multiple stakeholders

This activity can consume significant analyst time and may lead to delayed detection, missed failures, or inconsistent reporting.

There is a strong opportunity to leverage an AI agent to automatically extract job status, failures messages, and email stakeholders daily creating a consistent, scalable, and real-time monitoring mechanism so that IT can look into email and action on errored jobs.
Evidence:
Daily manual checks are required to validate whether hundreds of batch jobs have succeeded or failed.

Integration failures have downstream business impactâ€”delayed sales order creation, customer master issues, or operational bottlenecks.

Current manual reporting is highly dependent on individual team members and lacks standardization.

AI agents in D365 can automatically read Data Management job history logs, detect job state changes, and trigger communication workflows.
BusinessValue:
1. Operational Efficiency - Eliminates manual daily review of batch jobs.
Saves analyst time (estimated 1â€“2 hours/day), enabling reallocation to higher-value tasks.

2. Improved Integration Reliability - Ensures failures are detected immediately rather than waiting for manual review.
Reduces delays in order processing and customer onboarding.

3. Standardized & Accurate Reporting - Automated email reports ensure consistent communication across business units.
Includes job name, status (success/failure), company code, execution time, and a direct URL for error investigation.

4. Faster Resolution of Integration Issues - AI-generated summaries can include probable root cause or known remedies.
Reduces time to triage integration failures.

5. Scalability - Works for existing integrations (Oracle, Salesforce) and any future integration batches without additional manual effort.

6. Reduced Risk & Higher Data Quality - Minimizes business disruption caused by missed or delayed failure detection.
Ensures accurate and timely sales order and customer master data availability in D365.

UseCase: System Instruction Improver Using Hybrid Python
Headlines: Converting system instructions to hybrid python and offloading instructions to referernce files uses dramatically less tokens (and speeds results)
Opportunity: I've created a GPT that takes plain worded system instructions and optimizes them by converting the logic into python with hybrid comments and reference files. Evidence: Many of the prompts people are using are plain English and can get very complex taking up the entire 8000 character limit in system instructions. This GPT allows someone even if they don't know python to optimize their system instructions to allow a more effective prompt in many ways.
BusinessValue: Save money by using less tokens and providing faster responses in the LLM.

16â€“25 hours saved per month per manager (previously 17â€“25 hours vs. now ~2 minutes).

UseCase: ServiceNow Copilot Bot for Automated Incident & Change Request Creation
Headlines: AI-powered Teams chatbot that intelligently creates ServiceNow incidents and change requests based on user scenarios, reducing effort and improving compliance.
Opportunity:
AI is being used to simplify and automate the creation of ServiceNow incident and change requests through a conversational bot integrated into Microsoft Teams. Instead of users manually navigating ServiceNow and selecting from complex forms, the bot leverages conversational AI (NLU) to understand the scenario described by the user and determine the appropriate request type (incident or change) and classification (normal, standard, expedite, emergency).

The bot ensures accurate ticket creation by interpreting natural language inputs, extracting required metadata, validating context, and guiding users to follow organizational processes while minimizing manual effort.
Evidence:
Creating ServiceNow incidents and change requests is often time-consuming and varies in accuracy due to inconsistent understanding of required workflows. Users frequently struggle with identifying whether their scenario should trigger an incident or a change request, especially differentiating between non-prod/prod environments and urgency levels.

This results in:
Incorrect ticket categorization
Additional rework for support teams
Delays in issue resolution
Increased operational overhead
Lack of adherence to defined ITSM processes

An AI conversational bot removes this friction by automatically interpreting user descriptions and generating the appropriate ticket with the right details and workflow, reducing effort and ensuring process compliance.
BusinessValue:
Operational Efficiency
Significant reduction in time spent raising incidents and change requests
Less manual data entry and fewer errors
Faster initiation of support workflows

Improved Process Compliance
Automatic enforcement of correct ITSM process flows
Ensures correct ticket classification (incident vs. change; normal vs. standard vs. expedite, etc.)
Consistent data quality in ServiceNow submissions

Better User Experience
Intuitive conversational interaction through Microsoft Teams
No need for users to navigate through ServiceNow forms
Quick and guided ticket creation, especially for non-technical users

Support Team Productivity
Fewer incorrectly raised tickets lead to reduced rework
Improved routing and prioritization
Faster resolution times

Long-term Scalability
Ability to extend the bot to include updates, approvals, status checks, and knowledge suggestions
Foundation for broader AI-driven ITSM automation across the enterprise

Opportunity:

Navigating through D365 batch job history, reviewing each jobâ€™s success or failure, identifying error messages and resolutions, compiling a status report for business stakeholders, Redirecting IT staff to investigate issues

This manual process is time-consuming, highly repetitive, and prone to human oversight during a period where accuracy and timeliness are critical for financial close.

There is a clear opportunity to automate this end-to-end workflow using an AI agent that continuously monitors job status and triggers a detailed report without user intervention.
Evidence:
>Month end currently requires monitoring 140â€“150 jobs, manually checked one-by-one.
>Delays or missed failures can impact financial close timelines and downstream reporting.
>Repetitive monitoring consumes significant IT time during already high-pressure month-end cycles.
>AI agents can read batch job logs, classify failures, extract error messages, and generate direct D365 URLs for remediation.
BusinessValue:
Business Value â€“ Anticipated Benefits to UKG

Improved Operational Efficiency:
Automating D365 month-end batch job monitoring reduces manual effort, freeing teams to focus on higher-value financial and operational tasks.

Increased Accuracy and Reliability:
AI-driven monitoring minimizes human error, ensuring timely detection of failures and improving overall data integrity during critical month-end processes.

Faster Issue Resolution:
Automated alerts enable immediate response to job failures or delays, reducing downstream impacts and helping maintain month-end timelines.

Cost Savings:
Less manual oversight lowers labor costs and reduces rework caused by missed or late identifications of batch job issues.

Enhanced Scalability:
The automation can manage growing transaction volumes without requiring additional staff, supporting UKGâ€™s expanding business needs.

Consistent and Standardized Reporting:
Automated Outlook notifications ensure stakeholders receive timely, standardized updates, improving transparency and communication.

Improved Employee Experience:
Reducing repetitive monitoring tasks alleviates workload during high-pressure month-end periods, supporting employee well-being and productivity.

UseCase: AI-Driven Duplicate Workflow Detection and Smart Search
Headlines: AI-powered system to prevent duplicate workflows and enable smart, intuitive workflow discovery.
Opportunity:
AI is used to automatically detect duplicate or similar workflows and enable intelligent, natural-language search, helping employees quickly find and reuse existing workflows.
1) Current Process-
Any employee can create a workflow.Once created, the workflow can be:
a)Added to the R+ Library Workflow
b)Shared with others from the Library
c)There is no control or intelligence around:Detecting whether a similar workflow already exists in the Library,
Preventing users from creating and saving near-duplicate workflows.
1.1) Problems with the Current Process:-
a)Duplicate workflows
b)Different users may create very similar workflows and save them with different names.
c)This leads to multiple versions of essentially the same process.
1.2) Heavy / cluttered Library
a)The Library gradually becomes large and difficult to navigate.
b)Performance and usability may be impacted as the Library grows.
1.3) Inefficient search & reuse
a)Employees may not easily find workflows they created earlier.
b)Employees may not find existing workflows relevant to their need, and end up recreating them from scratch.
2. Proposed Enhancement Using AI
Introduce an AI-powered workflow assistant integrated with the R Plus Library to:
a)Identify similar workflows at the time of saving
b)Provide intelligent search across workflows in the Library
2.1) AI Similarity Check (Duplicate Prevention)
When a user attempts to save a new workflow to the Library:
a)The AI engine compares the new workflow against existing workflows in the Library (based on:
Steps
Purpose / description
Metadata like title, tags, etc.)
b)The system then:
Suggests similar or duplicate workflows already present in the Library.
Displays a list of â€œPotentially similar workflowsâ€ with:
Workflow name
Owner / creator
Brief description
Last updated date
User options:
Reuse an existing workflow (as-is or by copying and modifying).
Continue saving the new workflow if it is genuinely different.
Benefits:
Reduces duplicate workflows with different names.
Keeps the Library lean and more maintainable.
Encourages reuse instead of re-creation.
2.2. AI-Powered Workflow Search Engine
Add a search feature in the Library with the following capabilities:
â€œMy Workflowsâ€ search
Employees can quickly find workflows they have:
Created
Modified
Added to the Library
Filters: date, status, tags, usage frequency, etc.
Smart search by relatable / natural language terms
Employees can search for workflows using:
Business terms (e.g., â€œonboarding approvalâ€ , HR Actions, job requisitions etc)
Partial names or synonyms
Short descriptions of what they want to achieve
AI maps these queries to the most relevant workflows.
Recommendations
While a user types a query or starts creating a new workflow, the tool suggests:
â€œYou might be looking forâ€¦â€ existing workflows
Popular or frequently used workflows for similar requests
Benefits:
Saves time by allowing users to quickly locate:
Workflows they created earlier
Existing workflows that match their current business need
Reduces the need to build new workflows for already-solved use cases.
Improves overall user experience and adoption of the Library.
3. Expected Outcomes
Reduced duplication of workflows in the R Plus Library
Improved Library performance and usability
Higher reuse rate of existing workflows
Time savings for employees when creating or searching for workflows
Cleaner governance over workflow assets
Evidence:
1.Growing number of duplicate workflows-Multiple employees currently create workflows for similar or identical processes.These duplicates are often named differently, making them difficult to identify manually.
Library bloat continues to increase as new versions are added without visibility into existing ones.

2. Lack of intelligent search leads to rework-Users struggle to find workflows they created earlier due to limited search options.Employees often recreate workflows simply because they cannot locate an existing one.

3. Significant time wasted in workflow recreation-Employees spend unnecessary time building workflows from scratch that already exist in the Library.This leads to inefficiency and inconsistent process standards across teams.

4. Library usability declines as content grows-With hundreds or thousands of workflows stored, manual review becomes impractical.Overloaded libraries reduce adoption and discourage reuse.

5. No existing mechanism to prevent duplication-The system does not alert users if a similar workflow already exists at the time of saving.Without AI comparison or similarity detection, duplication naturally increases over time.

6. Inconsistent naming & metadata challenges-Different users use different naming conventions, spellings, and descriptions.This makes exact-match search ineffective, increasing reliance on semantic (AI) search capabilities.

7. Increasing need for standardization and governance-Without AI support, maintaining workflow quality, reusability, and standardization becomes progressively harder.AI acts as a governance layer to keep the Library clean, optimized, and compliant with best practices.
BusinessValue:
1.Increased Efficiency & Time Savings-AI eliminates the need for employees to manually search through large libraries or rebuild workflows from scratch. By surfacing similar workflows instantly and enabling natural-language search, employees can complete tasks faster and focus on higher-value work.

2. Reduction in Duplicate Effort-AI-driven similarity detection prevents multiple users from creating identical workflows under different names. This reduces rework, minimizes redundancy, and ensures that only necessary and unique workflows are added to the Library.

3. Improved Workflow Quality & Consistency-By guiding users toward existing standardized workflows, AI promotes best practices and encourages consistent process design across the organization. This helps ensure high-quality, uniform workflows that follow organizational standards.

4. Enhanced User Experience-With intelligent search and personalized â€œMy Workflowsâ€ access, employees can easily locate relevant workflows without guesswork or navigating an overloaded library. The result is a smoother, more intuitive user experience that drives higher adoption and satisfaction.

5. Optimized Library Management-AI helps maintain a cleaner, lighter, and more organized Library. Over time, this reduces management overhead, improves system performance, and ensures the Library remains a trusted repository of reusable workflows.

6. Better Governance & Compliance-By reducing uncontrolled duplication and improving visibility into existing workflows, the AI solution supports stronger governance. Teams can better track ownership, updates, and usage patterns, improving operational control and audit readiness.

7. Accelerated Decision-Making & Faster Request Fulfillment-With quick access to existing workflows and recommendations, teams can make faster decisions, respond to requests more quickly, and improve turnaround times for workflow-driven processes.

Headlines: Use an AI agent to read RevPro usage invoice splits and automatically draft the matching reclass journal in D365 F&O, giving Finance a smart, review-ready entry that aligns with UKGâ€™s AI strategy.
Opportunity:
To use AI to automate the detective work and heavy lifting in the usage-to-revenue reconciliation process â€” turning a manual, error-prone GL reclass into an intelligent, system-generated recommendation that Finance simply reviews and posts.

What AI Is Being Used For

Reading the RevPro split logic
(product-level percentages, covered products, split amounts)

Understanding the original D365 posting
(summarized usage SKU, deferred revenue account, dimensions)

Calculating the exact reclass needed
(how to move deferred revenue between product dimensions so D365 matches RevPro)

Drafting the Journal Entry automatically

Debit/credit accounts

Product dimensions

Amounts

Correlation IDs

Explanation text for auditors

Presenting the JE to Finance for approval
(AI does the analysis, Finance stays in control)

Creating a repeatable, scalable reconciliation engine
that can be extended to other revenue and GL matching scenarios in the future.

AI gives us a smart reconciliation assistant â€” it reads the RevPro splits, figures out the reclass, and drafts the journal so Finance only has to review and post
Evidence:
1. ERP and RevPro operate at different granularity levels

D365 posts one summarized usage line using a shared SKU (USAGE-SW-MONTHLY).

RevPro splits that same invoice into multiple product-level lines using revenue allocation %.

This immediately causes differences in Deferred Revenue by product between systems.

2. Manual reconciliations are already happening

Finance is currently forced to run manual adjusting JEs to break out deferred revenue by product so it ties to RevPro.

These JEs are time-consuming, error-prone, unscalable, and introduce control risk.

3. Manual reclasses donâ€™t trace back to the originating logic

Without automation, Finance has to re-calculate split amounts manually.

Hard for month-end approvers or auditors to validate whether the JE actually matches
RevPro logic.
â†’ AI can reliably follow the same logic every single time.

4. High volume makes manual work unsustainable

You have 20,000+ usage records per period â€” meaning 40,000+ reclass lines.

Finance cannot manually reconcile this with accuracy or speed.
â†’ Automation is the only realistic path at this scale.

5. No upstream fix exists

CPQ and D365 cannot be changed to hold product-level usage lines without redesigning Q2C and significantly increasing data volume.

RevPro must do the split â€” thatâ€™s the correct revenue accounting.
â†’ A downstream intelligent reconciliation layer is the only feasible solution.

6. SOX / audit expectations

Revenue is a key SOX control area.

Auditors expect:

Completeness and accuracy of system interfaces

Traceability for adjustments

Consistency in how revenue is recognized across systems
â†’ A system-generated, rule-derived JE is far more defensible than manual JEs.

7. Aligns with UKGâ€™s AI strategy

UKG is driving AI adoption across teams.

Reconciliation automation is one of the safest, most impactful starting points:

Structured data

Clear logic

High volume

Low risk

Immediate ROI
â†’ This is an ideal AI pilot.

8. Creates a reusable capability

Once AI learns to reconcile usage billing, the same engine can be reused for:

Deferred â†’ recognized revenue matching

FX variance explanations

Multi-entity eliminations

GL-subledger tie-outs
â†’ One investment â†’ multiple future wins.

We need this because D365 and RevPro hold usage data at different levels of detail, and Finance is forced into high-volume manual reclasses; AI can automatically calculate the exact reclass that aligns ERP with RevPro, satisfies audit expectations, and removes a recurring operational burden.
BusinessValue:
Automating the usage reclass aligns revenue across systems, reduces manual effort, strengthens audit controls, accelerates close, and builds a reusable AI capability for UKGâ€™s future Q2C transformation.

1. Accurate Revenue by Product

Aligning D365 and RevPro ensures usage revenue is reflected under the right product buckets (Pro, Central, Dimensions, Ready).
This improves margin analysis, product profitability reporting, and portfolio-level insights.

2. Reduced Manual Effort at Month-End

Todayâ€™s reconciliations require manual JE calculations, spreadsheets, and cross-system comparisons.
Automating the reclass removes a recurring operational burden and frees Finance to focus on analysis instead of clean-up.

3. Stronger Audit and SOX Compliance

System-generated reclass entries, backed by clear logic and correlation IDs, create a transparent audit trail and reduce control risk â€” especially around revenue, one of the highest-risk SOX areas.

4. Consistent, Repeatable Outcomes

Whether there are 20, 200, or 20,000 usage lines, automation ensures the same rules are applied every time with no human calculation errors or interpretation drift.

5. Faster, Cleaner Close

With the reconciliation heavy-lifting automated, UKG can shorten the month-end close cycle, reduce rework, and improve financial statement accuracy earlier in the process.

6. Scalable Foundation for Q2C Modernization (Nova)

Fixing reconciliation through automation creates a stable foundation for broader Q2C redesign.
It also prevents future technical debt by putting the detail in the right system and the intelligence in the right layer.

7. Upskilling & Innovation Opportunity

An AI-assisted reclass model is a safe, high-value pilot for Finance, Billing, and Integration teams.
It builds capabilities UKG can reuse across other reconciliation and automation opportunities.

8. Long-Term Cost Savings

Less manual effort + fewer errors + reduced rework = lower operational cost and higher accuracy over time.

UseCase: Guided D365 Security Role Request & Selection
Headlines: AI Chatbot -Guided Security: Automating D365 role provisioning to ensure compliance and eliminate role confusion across the enterprise.
Opportunity:
Opportunity: Intelligent Role Search and Mapping 
The core opportunity for applying Artificial Intelligence chat bot lies in translating ambiguous user queries into precise security terminology and guiding the user through the complex security catalog
Evidence:
Operational Bottlenecks 

Problem: The confusion over role names forces the BSA/Security team to manually review, analyze, and correct nearly every incoming access request. This time sink delays access provisioning and diverts valuable security resources from more strategic compliance tasks.

Impact: Slow provisioning impacts project timelines (e.g., delayed UAT access) and lowers user productivity. The cost of manual security review for a single request is prohibitively high.

Evidence Metric (To be Collected): Average time (in business days) from when a user submits an access request to when they receive the correct, approved D365 role (Average time currently exceeds 5 days).
BusinessValue:
Benefit: Automation of L1/L2 Security Support 
Description: The chatbot handles the initial request triage, role confusion resolution, and basic validation, removing the need for manual L1/L2 security or BSA involvement in the selection phase.
Key Metric/Goal: Increase in First-Pass Approval Rate: Achieve an access request approval rate of >90% (i.e., less than 10% require manual modification) upon first submission.


Benefit: Reduced Time-to-Access
Description: Removing manual back-and-forth between the user and the security team drastically shortens the time it takes for a user to gain the necessary system access.
Key Metric/Goal: Improved Provisioning Speed: Decrease the Average Time-to-Access (ATTA) for standard roles from the current benchmark (e.g., 5 days) to under 1 business day.

Benefit: Optimized Licensing Costs
Description: By accurately mapping users to the minimum required technical role, the system prevents the over-allocation of expensive high-tier D365 licenses (e.g., granting an 'Operations' license when only an 'Activity' license is needed).
Key Metric/Goal: Annual License Cost Savings: Identify and prevent the unnecessary allocation of $XX,XXX in high-tier D365 licenses annually.
TargetPersonas: Customer Success & Services,Help Desk Support and Incident Response,U Krewer

UseCase: Automated Monitoring Agents for WFM System
Headlines: AI-driven agents to validate page loads, measure uptime, and trigger alerts for critical workflows in WFM system
Opportunity: AI is used to build intelligent monitoring agents that log into customer systems, validate page load performance, capture uptime for screens and business processes, and proactively alert when anomalies occur (errors or slow load times).
Evidence:
â€¢	Manual monitoring is time-consuming and prone to human error. 
â€¢	Critical workflows (Payroll, Benefits, Recruiting, Scheduling) require high availability and performance. 
â€¢	Delays or failures can impact payroll processing, compliance, and employee experience.
Manual monitoring of page load performance for critical workflows in PRO and WFM systems is time-consuming and prone to human error. Current synthetic monitoring solutions only simulate user interactions through scripted paths and measure basic uptime and latency from an external perspective. They do not validate actual page load performance within the live customer environment for critical workflows.
Agent-based monitoring addresses this gap by logging into real production environments and validating page load times for key business process screens (e.g., Payroll Gateway, Recruiting, Scheduling). This ensures accurate detection of slow-loading pages enabling proactive alerting and SLA compliance
BusinessValue:
Anticipated Benefits to UKG:
â€¢	Improved System Reliability: Early detection of performance issues reduces downtime.
â€¢	Enhanced Customer Experience: Ensures smooth operation of critical HR/payroll workflows.
â€¢	Operational Efficiency: Automates monitoring, reducing manual effort and support costs.
â€¢	Risk Mitigation: Prevents SLA breaches and compliance risks by proactive alerting.

Headlines: One Stop Talent Acquisition Guide

By integrating AI-driven capabilities into TA operations, this project aims to create a unified, intelligent, and responsive system that supports recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates throughout the recruitment lifecycle.

- Hiring Manager Support: Assist hiring managers in understanding processes and best practices.

Headlines: Turning fragmented competitive data into actionable insights for smarter sales and product decisions.
Opportunity: AI is being leveraged to synthesize intelligence from multiple sourcesâ€”including win/loss data, analyst research, expert interviews, and competitive documentsâ€”into clear, factual, and actionable insights. This enables sales teams, product managers, and leadership to make data-driven decisions on competitive positioning, deal strategy, and roadmap priorities.
Evidence:
Current Challenge: Competitive intelligence is scattered across multiple repositories and formats (SharePoint decks, analyst reports, expert interviews, win/loss databases), making it time-consuming and inconsistent for teams to extract meaningful insights.
Impact: Sales teams often lack timely, consolidated intelligence during critical deal cycles, leading to lost opportunities and weaker positioning.
Market Reality: Competitors are rapidly evolving, and without a centralized, AI-driven synthesis, UKG risks reactive strategies instead of proactive competitive moves.
BusinessValue:
Accelerated Decision-Making: Reduce research time from hours/days to seconds by providing instant, synthesized insights.

UseCase: Intelligent Non-PO Invoice Process in Exflow
Headlines: Driving Scalable Efficiency through AI-Powered Smart Compliance in ExFlow
Opportunity:
AI is being leveraged to transform UKGâ€™s Non-PO invoice processing workflow in ExFlow into an intelligent, predictive, and scalable system. This initiative embeds automation and self-learning models into the Accounts Payable (AP) process to sustain UKGâ€™s ~<2-day processing benchmark while strengthening accuracy, governance, and control.

Key AI applications include:

Automated Compliance Validation
AI dynamically validates invoices against the USD 5K PO threshold and exemption categories (Utilities, Insurance, etc.), automatically flagging potential policy breaches in real time.
This eliminates repetitive manual checks and ensures consistent, rule-based enforcement across regions.

Predictive GL Code & Cost Center Assignment
Machine-learning models trained on historical Non-PO invoices predict the most appropriate GL Codes and Cost Centers, displaying confidence scores for review.
The system continuously improves through feedback, achieving > 85 % accuracy over time and reducing manual coding effort by over 60 %.

Empowers Requestors via a Self-Service Chatbot
A conversational AI assistant integrated into ExFlow/MS Teams empowers requestors to self-resolve compliance and coding queries such as PO requirements, exemption logic, and GL Code selection.
This reduces back-and-forth clarifications, improves first-time-right submissions, and accelerates approval turnaroundâ€”enhancing both accuracy and user experience.

Strategic Impact
By embedding AI into compliance validation, coding prediction, and requestor support, UKG elevates ExFlow from a transactional platform to a decision-intelligent engine.
This automation reduces manual effort in compliance validation, improves accuracy to > 95 %, and sustains a ~<2-day AP processing benchmark as invoice volumes continue to grow across global entities.
Evidence:
The Non-PO invoice process within ExFlow operates efficiently today but still relies on significant compliance and coding validation effort for policy adherence and exception handling. Each Non-PO invoice undergoes checks against the USD 5K PO rule and exemption categories, followed by processor-led GL Code and Cost Center allocation. While effective, these human-led validation activities consume valuable processing time and limit scalability as invoice volumes continue to rise â€” driven by Immedis and other vendor additions.

Current operational realities include:

Compliance and Coding Validation Effort: Over 1,700 Non-PO invoices are processed monthly, each requiring detailed checks against the USD 5K rule and applicable exemptions, along with GL Code and Cost Center allocation. The cumulative effort grows as new entities are added.

Repetitive Processing Effort: Processors repeatedly validate and assign GL Codes and Cost Centers based on historical data, creating duplication that limits focus on exception resolution or higher-value analysis.

Dependency on AP Expertise: While SOPs guide the process and human judgment ensures accuracy, many validations still rely on repetitive interpretation and verification. This dependency makes the process effort-heavy and difficult to scale consistently as invoice volumes and regional variations increase.

Limited Real-Time Visibility: Compliance and coding validations remain reactive rather than predictive, restricting proactive exception management and operational agility.

Without AI-enabled intelligence, these validation efforts will continue to consume time, constrain agility, and limit visibility across an expanding global AP ecosystem.
Embedding AI into compliance validation, coding prediction, and requestor support directly addresses these friction points â€” reducing validation effort by over 60 %, improving compliance accuracy to > 95 %, and enabling UKG to sustain a ~<2-day processing benchmark as invoice volumes increase across global entities.
BusinessValue:
Implementing AI-powered smart compliance within ExFlow will unlock measurable operational efficiency, strengthen governance, and enhance scalability across our global Accounts Payable (AP) operations.

Quantifiable Benefits:

Productivity Uplift: Automation of compliance validation and coding activities is projected to reduce validation effort by over 60 %, freeing capacity for exception handling and analytical tasks.

Accuracy and Compliance Gains: Machine-learning models will improve coding and compliance accuracy to > 95 %, minimizing policy deviations and rework.

Sustained Throughput Performance: AI-enabled processing will allow AP to maintain a ~<2-day invoice cycle time even as volumes expand through new entities such as Immedis, ensuring timely payment cycles and strong vendor relationships.

Operational Efficiency: The reduction in repetitive validations and clarifications translates into measurable time savings and improved process economics, enabling higher throughput without additional resource investment.

Strategic and Qualitative Benefits:

Scalability and Standardization: AI introduces consistency within global AP operations by supporting processors in repetitive validations, promoting accuracy, and enabling standardized, data-driven decision-making across entities and regions.

Employee Empowerment: The self-service chatbot empowers requestors and processors to resolve compliance and coding queries independently, promoting autonomy and faster resolution times.

Governance and Risk Control: Embedded AI strengthens policy adherence and audit readiness through rule-based accuracy, automated traceability, and proactive compliance validation across finance operations.

Global Resilience and Operational Maturity: As our AP footprint expands across new entities, currencies, and regulatory environments, AI-driven compliance ensures that efficiency, governance, and accuracy scale in tandem.

Future-Ready AP Function: Beyond sustaining speed, this initiative reinforces consistency, compliance accuracy, and operational resilience â€” ensuring that the AP function continues to operate as a global benchmark for efficiency and governance.

Sustained Control Integrity: Ultimately, this initiative enables us to scale without complexity â€” preserving efficiency while strengthening financial control integrity and compliance across entities and regions.
AITheme: Intelligent Document Processing,Predictive Modeling / Recommender,Machine Teaching / AutoML,Information Retrieval
TargetPersonas: Business Operations, Delivery & Enablement,Privacy, Regulatory & Compliance

UseCase: Credit & Concession Request Intake Form - Root Cause AI Assistant (V2)
Headlines: Improve customer billing escalation process through proper routing
Opportunity: We recently went live with our new Credit & Concession Request (CCR) intake form in Salesforce. This form is used for teams across UKG to submit various types of customer billing escalations, inquiries, credit requests, contract change requests, and termination requests. The routing for these requests is based on the primary, secondary, and tertiary root causes selected by the requestor. A major pain point for the teams responsible for reviewing and responding to these requests is improper routing based on the root causes selected. The root cause options are not always the most intuitive and accuracy is highly dependent on the requestor's level of expertise. The majority of the time, routing should really be based on the type of fee involved in the request (i.e. PEPM subscription fee minimums or overages, Service Requests, Launch Fees, Forms & Print Services, Hardware, etc.), though there are some exceptions to this. We would see major improvements in efficiency and effectiveness if we could ensure requests are routed to the appropriate team upon submission, as opposed to sitting in one backlog just to be re-routed and sitting in another backlog. AI could be utilized to ask some clarifying questions of the user, potentially pull invoice line details to understand the type of fee associated with the request, and help guide the user on which root causes to select to ensure appropriate routing. Additionally, AI could help answering some of the more basic questions or guide the requestor on how they can find the answer themselves.
Evidence: see above
BusinessValue: Increased customer satisfaction with reduced time to respond; reduced administrative effort on the resources involved in reviewing these requests
TargetPersonas: Customer Success & Services,Business Operations, Delivery & Enablement,Sales / Marketing Agents

UseCase: Improving Efficiency and Accuracy in Customer Monthly Employee Report Request and Distribution
Headlines: Explore opportunities to simplify and modernize the manual process for managing monthly customer report requests and distribution lists.
Opportunity:
There is an opportunity to apply AI and intelligent automation to improve the way monthly customer report requests are captured, validated, and fulfilled.
Today, customer requests come through AR representatives and are entered into a ServiceNow form, but there is no direct connection to the MDS master distribution list where the data is maintained. The process depends on manual monitoring, copy-and-paste updates, and dropdown selections.

AI could help by identifying more efficient ways to:

Streamline the flow of data from request to fulfillment.

Introduce automated validation or error detection for incomplete, duplicate, or invalid entries.

Provide greater visibility into existing customer setups and recipients.

Detect and manage termed customers to keep the distribution list current.
Evidence:
The current workflow is manual from end to end: customers email AR reps, AR reps enter data into ServiceNow, and the Finance fulfillment team re-enters that data into MDS.

Each month, roughly 20â€“25 requests are processed, each taking 2â€“5 minutes but requiring completion before the 4th of the month to avoid missed customer reports.

There are no system checks to prevent internal email addresses, duplicates, or inactive customers from remaining on the list.

Report selections are made manually through dropdowns, which is error-prone and inconsistent.

When a customer terms, there is no structured offboarding process; removal from MDS depends on ad-hoc AR submissions, resulting in outdated or non-compliant records.

These factors collectively create risk of mis-delivered or missed reports, rework, and a negative customer experience.
BusinessValue:
Exploring AI or automation for this process could:

Reduce manual re-entry and administrative workload for Finance Systems.

Improve accuracy, consistency, and compliance in customer reporting data.

Ensure customers receive their reports on time, strengthening trust and satisfaction.

Provide a more scalable, controlled process that supports future growth.

Introduce stronger auditability and lifecycle management for customer report distribution.

As a result, Legal Operations lacks a unified, reliable dataset to inform rate negotiations and budgeting decisions.
BusinessValue:
Efficiency: Reduce manual data cleansing effort and turnaround time.

Accuracy: Ensure consistent, comparable timekeeper data across firms.

Insights: Enable dynamic benchmarking for rate review and approvals.

Governance: Strengthen data-driven decision making for new timekeepers and rate increases.

Scalability: Framework can extend to other financial and vendor datasets over time.

This use of AI transforms a time-consuming, document-heavy process into a scalable, intelligent, and audit-ready workflow.

Consistency and accuracy: Standardized analysis across vendors, eliminating human interpretation bias.

Audit readiness: Automated population of review templates ensures consistent, traceable documentation for internal and external audits.

Scalability: Enables the team to handle more vendor assessments without additional resources.

Enhanced visibility: Provides structured, summarized insights for leadership on vendor control health and exceptions.

Headlines: Our current knowledge base suffers gaps where key content is missing. The responsibility for identifying and maintaining these gaps has fallen heavily on the Knowledge team, who must manually review large volumes of content without the tools or scale need
Opportunity:
Our current knowledge base suffers gaps where key content is missing. The responsibility for identifying and maintaining these gaps has fallen heavily on the Knowledge team, who must manually review large volumes of content without the tools or scale needed to keep pace with evolving customer and product needs. 

This results in: 

 

Inefficient knowledge maintenance â€” SMEs and the Knowledge team spend excessive time searching for and reviewing potential gaps or duplicates rather than improving content quality. 

 

Poor customer and agent experience â€” Agents and customers encounter conflicting, irrelevant, or missing information, leading to higher effort, increased case volumes, and lower satisfaction. 

 

Delayed publishing of valuable content â€” Critical knowledge often takes too long to be created or updated, slowing down case resolution and reducing support effectiveness.
Evidence:
Knowledge Management Process 

The Knowledge team currently shoulders most of the responsibility for maintaining content quality. 

Gaps in the knowledge base (missing articles, duplicates, outdated or low-value content) are identified manually, requiring significant time and effort. 

SMEs are not consistently or systematically engaged in identifying or validating knowledge gaps; their role is limited to ad-hoc contributions. 

SMEs inconsistently create or edit knowledge based on their current cases. 

There is no automated mechanism to detect duplicate, outdated, or irrelevant content. 

The Knowledge team often spends more time finding content issues rather than resolving them. 

There is no current process for SMEs to create knowledge articles for gaps once they are identified.
BusinessValue:
By introducing AI-driven gap detection and article creation we aim to: 

 

Shift effort from discovery to validation â€” AI identifies potential gaps and duplicates; SMEs and Knowledge teams focus on reviewing and publishing. 

 

Improve accuracy and trust in the knowledge base by ensuring articles are current, non-duplicative, and relevant. 

 

Streamline the content lifecycle so articles move efficiently from draft to publish or removal, reducing delays.

Headlines: Use AI to review customer sales orders (with greater than $1M annual recurring revenue) and agreements to identify the performance obligations, determine the transaction price, and to identiy any non-standard terms and conditions
Opportunity:
On a monthly basis, the Technical Revenue Team reviews all SaaS (Software as a service) customer sales orders generating greater than $1M ARR (annual recurring revenue) to ensure compliance with the Company's revenue recognition policies. 
The analyst reviews the order and agreements to ensure they are signed and to identiy if any non standard terms and conditions are present in the order form (order ntoes) and MSA (master sales agreement). The analyst completes a manual revenue calculation which follows the ASC 66 five step process to determine when revenue is to be recognizd on various promises of a contract.
1. Identify Contract(s) with the Customer (ASC 606-10-25-1 to 606-10-25-13)
2. Identify the Performance Obligations in the Contract (ASC 606-10-25-14 to 606-10-25-22)
3. Determine the Transaction Price (ASC 606-10-32-2 to 606-10-32-27)
4. Allocate the Transaction Price to Performance Obligations in the Contract (ASC 606-10-32-28 to 606-10-32-41)
5. Recognize Revenue as and when the Performance Obligations are Satisfied (ASC 606-10-25-23 to 606-10-25-30)
The analyst answers a series of checklist questions meant to identify and document areas of risk and any corresponding revenue judgements.
The manually calculated revenue is compared to RevPro reported revenue.
The opportnity is to use AI to review the sales orders and agreements and to summarize key information, help identify performance obligations and the resulting transaction prices, note any non-standard terms and conditions that may exist within the order form or agreements which would impact revenue reconition.
Evidence: The review of material contracts is a critical process to ensure compliance with the Companyâ€™s revenue recognition policies. These contracts are often large and complex, requiring detailed analysis to identify key terms and conditions. Essential information is dispersed across sales orders and corresponding agreements, making the review process time-consuming and resource-intensive for the Technical Revenue Team.
BusinessValue: Ensuring accurate revenue recognition is essential for maintaining compliance with accounting standards and supporting reliable financial reporting. Material contracts often involve complex terms and conditions that directly impact revenue recognition. Currently, the process of reviewing these contracts requires significant manual effort, as critical information is spread across multiple documents such as sales orders and agreements. Streamlining this process would enhance efficiency, reduce compliance risk, and allow the Technical Revenue Team to focus on higher-value analysis and decision-making.
AITheme: Data Extraction,Document Summarization,Information Retrieval,Intelligent Document Processing

UseCase: OCR Email Review Monitoring for Non-Managed Email Inboxes
Headlines: OCR Email Review Monitoring for Non-Managed Email Inboxes
Opportunity: It would monitor shared inboxes for messages and attachment details, route emails by set rules, alert team members, respond to senders when needed, and convert unsupported file formats if required.
Evidence:
Our Vendor Success (AP) team currently monitors an email inbox (disregarded-ap@ukg.com) for important correspondence/invoices that would otherwise not be captured.  This inbox receives emails from ap@ukg.com that do not contain attachments or contain attachments that are invalid for our invoice scanning/capture process (non-PDF, such as excel, etc.).  Although the sender receives a response when submitting an email to ap@ukg.com to advise that the inbox is not monitored for correspondence, AP added this additional check to minimize escalations (ex. vendors asking questions and not getting responses or submitting invoices timely but in the wrong format).

While we can setup some rules based on the email message (ex. subject/body "contains", etc.), much of the review takes place within the attachment, meaning the team needs to open each to determine next steps.  It would be great if we could expand on this with AI, having AI scan the attachments for key attributes such as "invoice", "statement", "invoice date", etc. and then route those appropriately.  We could also incorporate some logic to automatically convert the invalid files to an appropriate format (PDF) and send the document (assuming an invoice) back into the AP@UKG.COM email address to reduce delay in receipt and processing.
BusinessValue: This would free up a tremendous amount of time for our team and would be very scalable to many other functions with similar problems.  This would also keep our Vendor Success (AP) team focused on one system (ServiceNow) as opposed to having to navigate questions through email, also.

Headlines: Performs redlining, clause analysis, and flags negotiation
Evidence:
User/problem signals (qualitative):

Recurring needs to â€œcompare two drafts,â€ â€œsummarize key changes,â€ and â€œflag risky language.â€

Pain around defined-term drift and numbering/cross-ref errors during late-stage edits.

Business stakeholders asking for plain-language summaries and negotiation talking points.

Solution fit (capability proof):

The assistant already delivers: version comparison with explicit add/delete markup; clause categorization; defined-term checks; risk assessment with âš ï¸ Negotiation Needed; jurisdiction-aware notes; and confidentiality scrubbing to placeholders ([Party A], [Party B]).

Output templates align with how legal teams package deliverables (change logs, exec summaries, negotiation briefs).

Operational feasibility:

Deterministic, formatted outputs suitable for handoff to counsel or deal teams.

Works without external data connections; safe default stance (analytical, not legal advice).

Validation plan & metrics (to quantify impact):

Accuracy: Precision/recall on clause detection, defined-term consistency, cross-ref integrity vs. human baseline.

Efficiency: Time-on-task reduction for (a) first-pass redline, (b) risk triage, (c) executive summary creation.

Quality: Attorney review ratings (e.g., â€œusable as-is,â€ â€œminor edits,â€ â€œmajor editsâ€).

Business: Deal cycle time to signature, % drafts requiring outside counsel rework, user retention on repeat matters.
BusinessValue:
Faster deal cycles: Automates first-pass redlines, clause tagging, and summaries, shortening review loops and pulling revenue forward.

Lower legal cost per contract: Reduces in-house hours and outside-counsel spend by handling comparison, term checks, and drafting of exec/negotiation summaries.

Better risk posture at scale: Consistently flags high-risk language (âš ï¸ Negotiation Needed), undefined terms, and broken cross-referencesâ€”fewer â€œleaksâ€ into signed paper.

Higher consistency & quality: Standardized outputs (redlines, change logs, executive summaries) reduce variance between reviewers and minimize rework/escalations.

Scalable peak coverage: Absorbs end-of-quarter surges without adding headcount; repeatable deliverables for sales, procurement, and finance.

Knowledge capture: Encodes negotiation patterns and playbook-aligned suggestions; improves onboarding and continuity.

Quantified Impact (model)

Use these levers to estimate ROI; swap in your numbers.

Assumptions (example):

Contract volume: 600/year

Time saved per contract (first-pass + triage): 1.5â€“3.0 hrs

Blended legal cost/hour (in-house or external): $150â€“$300

Cost savings (time):
Annual Hours Saved = Volume Ã— Hours Saved
Annual $ Saved = Annual Hours Saved Ã— Blended Rate
â†’ With 600 Ã— 2.0h Ã— $200 = $240,000/year (illustrative).

Revenue acceleration (cycle time):
If average legal review drops 4 days, and ~20% of deals slip past quarter-end due to review, pulling even 10% of those into-quarter can materially improve bookings and cash. (Quantify with your ASP Ã— #deals pulled in.)

Outside counsel avoidance:
If 15% of drafts currently go to outside counsel for basic redlining at ~2h each, shifting half to the assistant saves:
0.5 Ã— 0.15 Ã— Volume Ã— 2h Ã— $350 â†’ For 600/year â‰ˆ $31,500 (illustrative).

Rework/quality savings:
Fewer broken cross-refs/undefined terms reduces back-and-forth and re-signs; even 0.25h saved per contract at $200/h adds â‰ˆ $30,000/year at 600/year.

Role-Specific Value

Sales/RevOps: Shorter â€œlegal in reviewâ€ stage; predictable redline turnaround; clearer negotiation talking points to unblock deals.

Legal: Focus shifts from mechanical comparison to strategic edits; fewer late-stage surprises; consistent jurisdiction-aware commentary.

Procurement: Faster vendor paper review; standardized risk flags for approvals; better audit readiness.

Finance/Execs: Pull-forward of revenue, reduced external spend, and clearer risk reporting via executive summaries.

Operational Advantages

Deterministic, handoff-ready outputs: Markup [~del~]/[+add+], clause labels, and change logs slot directly into existing workflows.

Governance & auditability: Automatic party anonymization and defined-term checks reduce confidentiality and compliance friction.

Low lift to adopt: Works on drafts you already have; no system integration required to start.

KPIs to Track

Cycle time: Draft-to-signature (and â€œlegal in reviewâ€ SLA).

Legal effort per contract (hours) and outside-counsel hours/cost.

% drafts with high-risk flags resolved pre-signature.

Redline accuracy vs. human baseline; rework rate.

Exec summary turnaround time; stakeholder satisfaction (CSAT).

Headlines: Coaches users to refine SMART goals and complete self-assessments.
Opportunity:
This GPT (SMART Goal Coach) is designed to address a very common challenge in professional development and performance management: **people often struggle to write clear, actionable goals and reflect meaningfully on their progress.** The opportunity lies in:

* Helping employees **translate vague ambitions into SMART goals** (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound).
* Guiding **self-assessments** so they are thoughtful, constructive, and forward-looking â€” rather than rushed or surface-level.
* Supporting a culture of **accountability and growth** by reinforcing best practices in goal-setting and reflection.
* Reducing stress during performance review cycles by offering coaching-style guidance, without replacing a managerâ€™s role.
* Building consistency across an organization â€” making it easier for managers and employees to have productive review conversations.

### **The Idea Itâ€™s Being Used For**

This GPT is being used as a **personal performance and development coach**, focused on:

1. **SMART Goal Creation** â€“ helping users break down draft goals into SMART elements with clarifying questions.
2. **Self-Assessment Coaching** â€“ guiding users to reflect on achievements, challenges, learnings, and next steps.
3. **Constructive Framing** â€“ supporting users when goals arenâ€™t fully met by turning setbacks into learning opportunities.
4. **Performance Review Preparation** â€“ simulating review scenarios so employees feel confident in manager discussions.
5. **Education & FAQs** â€“ explaining why SMART goals matter and how to use them effectively in performance cycles.

ðŸ‘‰ In other words, the idea is to provide a **coaching assistant for performance management**, helping employees feel supported, managers receive higher-quality input, and organizations strengthen their review process.
Evidence: Itâ€™s needed because it makes goal setting and self-reflection easier, clearer, and more impactful â€” for both employees and managers.
BusinessValue: In business terms, the value to UKG is increased productivity, stronger alignment, reduced manager workload, higher employee engagement, and more consistent talent development.

Opportunity: UKG has a hotel travel policy with specific rate caps per city along with UKG Preferred Hotels. The travel team is interested in using AI to assist with calling out hotel bookings that are out of policy, along with bookings at hotels outside of our Preferred Program is specific cities. We currently manually review transaction reports and update reservations in Egencia, which we would like automate. An AI Agent can review a list of our negotiated hotels and rate caps, and call out any transactions that are out of policy for the travel team to action. Utlizing AI could significanly shorten the time spent in reviewing data from Egencia so we can action all transactions that are out of policy.
Evidence: We have high savings goals in FY26 and reducing costs in hotel spend is a high priority for our travel team this year.
BusinessValue: We estimate that if we had the ability to update all out of policy hotel bookings with lower rates or move to preferred hotels, we could save $240K annually in travel spend.

Headlines: The UKG Prompt Quality Framework: Ensuring Clear, Compliant, and Actionable AI Prompts
Opportunity: Enable users to quickly convert vague or incomplete prompts into structured, production-ready instructions that ensure clarity, compliance, and high-quality outcomes
Evidence:
This GPT is needed because it eliminates ambiguity, enforces best practices, and accelerates AI adoption by ensuring every prompt is clear, compliant, and high-quality.

Organizations face a consistent challenge in maximizing the value of AI due to poorly written prompts. Vague, incomplete, or ambiguous prompts result in outputs that are inaccurate, inconsistent, or non-compliant, forcing users to rely on trial-and-error iterations that waste time and reduce trust in AI systems. Without a standardized approach to prompt quality, teams risk inefficiency, compliance breaches, and uneven adoption of AI across the enterprise. A solution is needed to streamline and professionalize the prompt creation process, ensuring every request to AI is precise, compliant, and aligned with business objectives.
BusinessValue: The Prompt Upgrader directly addresses this gap by enabling users to generate structured, production-ready prompts automatically. By embedding best practices, compliance guardrails, and clarity into every interaction, it reduces inefficiencies, lowers risk, and drives consistency across teams. This creates tangible business value in the form of faster decision-making, improved output quality, reduced compliance exposure, and scalable AI adoption that supports strategic goals such as efficiency, automation, and innovation.

UseCase: Business Personal Property Tax Invoice Management Automation
Headlines: Business Personal Property Tax Invoice Management Automation
Opportunity: The idea is to use AI to make the process of checking and approving property tax invoices faster and more accurate. Right now, teams have to manually check if invoices are already paid, confirm vendor details, search government websites for tax info, and respond to notices. This takes a lot of time and can lead to mistakes like duplicate payments or missed deadlines. AI tools like Co-Pilot help by automatically spotting duplicate invoices, pulling up the latest tax data, tracking payments, and organizing documents for quick responses. This saves time, reduces errors, and helps the team stay compliant with tax rules.
Evidence:
Automation is needed to solve real pain points in the current manual process. Right now, tasks like checking invoice duplicity, verifying tax details, and responding to state notices are done manually. This takes time, increases the chance of errors, and can lead to financial losses or compliance issues. By automating these steps using AI tools like Co-Pilot, the team can:

Save time by reducing repetitive tasks
Avoid mistakes like duplicate payments or missed deadlines
Improve compliance with tax regulations
Make faster decisions using real-time data
BusinessValue: Automating the invoice validation and approval process brings strong business value by saving time, reducing errors, and improving compliance. It helps the team avoid duplicate payments, catch outdated tax bills, and respond to state notices faster. This means fewer financial losses and less manual work. With AI tools doing the heavy lifting, employees can focus on more strategic tasks. Overall, it boosts efficiency, protects the company from penalties, and ensures smoother operations in tax management.

UseCase: AI-Assisted Reconciliation for Payroll Export Files
Headlines: ChatGPT extracts totals, applies DTP rules, and generates a 2-sheet Excel (Empower 401K & CYC CT) with variance checks.
Opportunity:
AI-Assisted Reconciliation for Payroll Export Files

Current Challenge

At present, the team manually reconciles multiple reports:

401K Export file (employee 401(k) contributions from payroll)

CYC CT Export file (health benefit accounts: HSAs, FSAs, HRAs)

Summary Payroll Register (SPR) Report

401K Loan Report

This reconciliation is performed twice (test and final), and the manual process takes ~20â€“25 minutes per run, with a high risk of oversight or calculation errors.

AI Idea

Leverage AI (ChatGPT or a similar LLM + automation) to:

Ingest multiple export files and reports (SPR, 401K Export, CYC CT Export, Loan Report).

Apply data transformation and validation rules (DTP rules) automatically.

Extract totals and perform variance checks between datasets.

Generate a standardized Excel output with two sheets:

Empower 401K reconciliation

CYC CT reconciliation
Each sheet highlights variances for quick review.

Benefits

Efficiency: Reduces reconciliation time from ~25 minutes to a few minutes.

Accuracy: Minimizes manual errors in comparing multiple complex datasets.

Scalability: Can be extended to other benefit or payroll export reconciliations.

Audit Readiness: Standardized variance reports provide clear documentation.
Evidence: Itâ€™s needed to save time, reduce errors, strengthen compliance, and improve employee experience by ensuring payroll-related exports and benefits are reconciled quickly and accurately.
BusinessValue: AI-driven reconciliation will cut processing time from 25 minutes to just a few minutes, boosting team productivity while reducing manual errors. Standardized variance reports strengthen compliance and audit readiness, lowering risk exposure. The solution is scalable across payroll and benefits processes, delivering cost savings and reinforcing trust with clients and employees. Ultimately, it positions UKG as an innovator in AI-powered payroll automation.

UseCase: Unlock Faster, Smarter Presentation Creation with Prezent.ai
Headlines: Unlock Faster, Smarter Presentation Creation with Prezent.ai
Opportunity: As we scale, our executive communications team needs to be less dependent on the creative team for everyday presentations. Today, building decks consumes significant time and resources, with recurring challenges around consistency, brand alignment, and speed. Prezent.ai uses AI to transform content and ideas into polished, on-brand presentations quickly. This allows the executive communications team to self-serve for routine needs, saves hours of work per presentation, and frees the creative team to focus on higher-value, strategic projects â€” while ensuring consistency in messaging and design.
Evidence:
- Our executive communications team regularly produces high-stakes presentations for leadership, board members, and company-wide events. These decks require speed, polish, and alignment with brand standards.
- Today, the process is time-consuming and highly dependent on the creative team, which creates a bottleneck and slows delivery.
- As volume increases with company growth and transformation initiatives, this model is not sustainable. We risk delays, over-reliance on a small group of designers, and inconsistency when teams create decks on their own.
- Industry benchmarks show that employees spend up to 30% of their time preparing presentations. Tools like Prezent.ai have been shown to cut production time by more than half while improving consistency and brand adherence.
- By equipping the executive communications team with Prezent.ai, we can reduce routine creative team requests, accelerate turnaround, and ensure a higher standard of storytelling across leadership communications.
BusinessValue:
- Increased Efficiency: By enabling the executive communications team to quickly generate polished, on-brand decks, we reduce time spent on manual formatting and design. This translates into faster turnaround on executive priorities and more bandwidth for strategic storytelling.
- Cost Savings: Reducing dependency on the creative team for everyday presentations frees design resources to focus on high-value projects such as brand campaigns, major events, and external-facing materials. This optimizes resource allocation without increasing headcount.
- Consistency & Quality: Prezent.ai ensures that all presentations are aligned with brand guidelines and executive messaging, lowering the risk of off-brand materials and improving the professionalism of leadership communications.
- Scalability: As the company grows, the volume of executive presentations will increase. Prezent.ai provides a scalable solution that prevents bottlenecks and maintains quality under greater demand.
- Strategic Impact: Faster, more consistent presentation development improves leadershipâ€™s ability to communicate vision, strategy, and results effectively â€” directly supporting employee alignment and company performance.

UseCase: Auto Case Generation for Service Now
Headlines: Reducing Manual Effort and Risk with Automated ServiceNow Requests
Opportunity: The idea is to leverage AI to automatically generate ServiceNow tickets for recurring requests such as FPS access, security group modifications, and elevated access. Instead of manually submitting these requests, AI would recognize the need, apply pre-defined parameters, and create the tickets instantly. This reduces repetitive manual effort, accelerates response times, and improves accuracy, allowing IT teams to focus on higher-value work while ensuring consistent handling of common access and security requests.
Evidence: During critical periods such as year-end, the print shop must onboard and later offboard approximately 125 temporary employees. Each onboarding requires multiple repetitive ServiceNow tickets: four separate FPS access requests, additional security group modifications, and print shop access permissions. This creates hundreds of nearly identical tickets in a short timeframe, placing a heavy manual burden on IT staff. Automating this process with AI would eliminate repetitive work, ensure accuracy in access provisioning, and significantly reduce turnaround time, which is especially valuable during peak seasonal demand.
BusinessValue:
AI-driven ticket automation will significantly reduce the manual effort of creating repetitive ServiceNow requests. Currently, onboarding one employee requires multiple tickets and can take 10â€“20 minutes per employee to complete. At peak times, such as year-end when 125 employees are onboarded, this equates to 20â€“40+ hours of manual work spent solely on ticket creation. Automating this process will:

Save time and resources by eliminating repetitive manual entry.

Increase accuracy and consistency in access requests, reducing the risk of errors or missed steps.

Accelerate onboarding and offboarding timelines, ensuring employees are productive faster and compliance requirements are met.

Free Print Management staff to focus on higher-value, strategic work rather than administrative tasks.
TargetPersonas: Help Desk Support and Incident Response

Headlines: Ferrero Funding Reconciliation using ChatGPT
Opportunity:
Current Process: 
The Funding Total and the Summary Payroll Register amount should be balanced as a part of the after-payroll process. We are required to manually reconcile the Funding Report with the Summary Payroll Register. To facilitate this, a new row should be added to the Funding Report to reflect the totals from the Summary Payroll Register. Subsequently, we must compare the corresponding amounts for the following categories: Direct Deposits, Check Amount, Employee Tax Amount, Employer Tax Amount, Garnishments, 401(k) Employee Contribution, 401(k) Employer Contribution, 401(k) Loans, Roth Employee Contribution, and Roth Employer Contribution.
Evidence: There are multiple codes associated with Garnishments and 401(k) Loans, which must be manually aggregated to determine the final amounts for each category. If any code is missed during this process, the resulting Garnishment or 401(k) Loan totals will not align with the corresponding amounts in the Funding Report. Additionally, this manual reconciliation process is time-consuming and contributes to delays in balancing.
BusinessValue: Utilizing ChatGPT enabled us to complete the task both efficiently and accurately. By simply providing clear instructions and shared Summary Payroll Register, Funding Report and Deduction Code report, we were able to obtain a correctly formatted and reconciled output file with minimal effort. It save approx 75 hours annually. Also, we can look at ways to make this process the same for all clients and use this prompt as common tool to help us work faster and more accurately.

Headlines: Automating Payroll GL Interface and Reconciliation Process
Opportunity: This proposal outlines the automation of the General Ledger (GL) Interface and Reconciliation Process currently performed manually after each payroll run for US-based clients using UKG Pro Web & Backoffice. The proposed automation leverages a combination of RPA tools, BI platforms, scripting, and workflow orchestration to eliminate repetitive tasks, ensure higher accuracy, reduce turnaround time, and improve client satisfaction.
Evidence:
The manual process involves several high-effort and error-prone steps:
- Manually running the GL Interface after each payrun.
- Pulling multiple standard reports and BI/Cognos reports.
- Performing DR vs CR validation and identifying GL suspense entries.
- Manually notifying stakeholders if suspense exists.
- Re-running the GL post-resolution, again manually.

These steps are:
- Time-intensive, especially across multiple clients.
- Error-prone, with manual reconciliation and report handling.
- Reactive, leading to delays in issue resolution and GL posting.
- Non-scalable, with increasing client volume and payroll frequency.
BusinessValue:
The proposed automation aims to:
1. Automate repetitive steps in the post-payroll GL process.
2. Standardize the validation and reconciliation process.
3. Proactively flag and notify suspense situations.
4. Ensure faster GL finalization and reduce rework cycles.
5. Provide dashboards and audit logs for transparency.

Headlines: AI-Powered After Payroll Agent: Elevating Accuracy, Eliminating Manual Effort
Opportunity: This proposal outlines the automation of the After-Payroll Reporting and Reconciliation process performed manually after each payroll run for UKG clients. The proposed automation leverages a combination of UKG Pro tools, RPA platforms, BI/Cognos reports, and intelligent scripting to streamline the reporting cycle, reduce reconciliation time, ensure accuracy, and support audit readiness with standardized SSAE16 documentation
Evidence:
The manual After-Payroll process presents multiple inefficiencies:
- Pulling 8+ standard reports manually by pay group and company.
- Extracting client-specific reports from BI/Cognos.
- Entering figures from reports and banking confirmations into a reconciliation (PPR) template.
- Identifying and reasoning tax variances manually.
- Creating SSAE16 folders and compiling final documentation.

These challenges make the process:
- Time-intensive and repetitive.
- Susceptible to manual entry errors.
- Inconsistent across clients and payroll teams.
- Lacking proactive visibility into reconciliation exceptions.
BusinessValue:
The proposed automation initiative aims to:
1. Eliminate repetitive manual actions across reporting and reconciliation.
2. Standardize the PPR template population and SSAE16 packaging.
3. Improve accuracy of tax variance analysis.
4. Enhance turnaround time and audit compliance.
5. Support scalability across multiple clients and payroll frequencies.

Headlines: Automattion of TDS rationalization using AI to Elimination manual efforts and Save time
Opportunity:
Problem statement - 

1. The current TDS framework in India involves multiple rates, thresholds, and compliance requirements across various sections of the Income Tax Act. 
2. It also involves multiple vendors with multiple GL expense account. These vendors are the required to be allocated over various expense schedule tab.
3. TDS return contains details of each vendor with TDS and base amount that needs to be matched with each vendor present in the expense schedule which is time-consuming and error prone.
4. An analysis is required wherein TDS is whether correctly deducted as per LDC, as per correct rate, correct threshold has been applied ?with remarks of short deduction and non-deduction.

Expected solution â€“
 
1. There is a need to rationalize the TDS structure to simplify compliance, reduce administrative overhead, and ensure equitable tax collection without adversely impacting revenue.
2. Use AI to extract vendor details, GL codes, and expense data from ERP systems and map them to the correct expense schedule tabs.AI can interpret unstructured data and standardize formats.
3. AI models can match TDS return data with expense schedules at a vendor level.
4. Flag mismatches and generate reconciliation reports automatically.
5. Implement a rule trained on TDS provisions to:
-Validate deduction against LDCs.
-Check applicable rates and thresholds.
-Identify short/non-deduction cases and auto-tag remarks.
Evidence: It is needed to Automate TDS rationalization using AI technology to reduce errors and save manual efforts.
BusinessValue:
Key benefits for UKG include time savings, scalability, and improved audit transparency for executive decision-making.
We are expecting to save ~ 50 Hours per entity and 100 hours for both the Kronos India entities Annually .

UseCase: AI Copilot for Collections: Streamlined AR Follow-Up Directly in Outlook
Headlines: Accelerate cash flow and reduce manual effort by bringing D365 collections data and AI-generated follow-ups directly into Outlook.
Opportunity: The proposed use case is to deploy Microsoft Copilot for Finance to integrate Dynamics 365 collections data directly into Outlook, transforming the way UKG manages accounts receivable follow-up. Today, AR specialists spend significant time toggling between D365 and Outlook to retrieve balances, review communications history, and draft follow-up messages. This repetitive, manual work is time-consuming and often delays collections. With Copilot, collections staff would see real-time account summaries, outstanding balances, and prior interactions surfaced directly in Outlook, alongside AI-generated, tailored draft emails with recommended next steps. This approach allows finance staff to complete collections activities in the same tool where customer communication already occurs, eliminating inefficient system switching and reducing cycle times.
Evidence: Collections processes are one of the most resource-intensive areas of finance operations, and specialists often spend up to 30% of their day gathering data and manually crafting outreach. Microsoft has already demonstrated in pilots that embedding collections data in Outlook can meaningfully reduce average handling time per account and accelerate days sales outstanding (DSO). For UKG, where AR teams manage thousands of accounts each month, even a modest efficiency gain has measurable impact. If Copilot reduces handling time by 20â€“30% as seen in other organizations, an AR specialist currently spending 20 hours a week on manual follow-up could save 4â€“6 hours. Scaled across a team of 20 specialists, this equates to more than 100 hours saved weekly, or over 5,000 hours annually. That capacity can either reduce cost or be redirected toward more strategic collections strategies, such as targeted outreach to high-risk accounts.
BusinessValue: The anticipated business value extends beyond time savings. Faster and more consistent collections activity has a direct cash flow impact by shortening DSO, ensuring UKG receives payments sooner and improves working capital. AI also improves accuracy and compliance by standardizing outreach, ensuring communications are audit-ready, and reducing the risk of errors or inconsistent tone across customer messages. Finally, embedding collections automation directly in Outlook enhances the employee experience by allowing specialists to work more seamlessly in the tools they already use every day. In summary, this use case will accelerate cash flow, reduce manual effort, and enable UKGâ€™s finance teams to focus on higher-value activities rather than administrative tasks.

Headlines: An AI agent that Compares UKG vs vendor contract exhibits, identifies gaps, risks, and maps to standards.

Without a standardized, repeatable method, critical gaps (e.g., insufficient audit rights or data protection clauses) may be missed, leading to regulatory exposure or contractual risk. AI addresses this need by enabling systematic, clause-by-clause analysis, flagging deviations, and ensuring no required language is overlooked.
BusinessValue:
