Opportunity: To harness AIâ€™s natural language processing (NLP) and pattern recognition capabilities to automatically ingest and analyze Reports generated . The AI model will identify key failures, critical warnings, and trends, filter out non-essential noise, and generate clear, human-readable summaries. These summaries will then be automatically formatted and distributed -attached to relevant JIRA tickets, integrated into dashboards, or sent as structured updates via collaboration tools like Slack or Teams.
Evidence: Reports are often lengthy, verbose, and inconsistent in format. Teams spend excessive time manually reviewing these to locate critical issues, leading to slower resolution, missed findings, and delayed releases.
BusinessValue:
Reduced time spent manually reviewing reports

Early detection of critical issues and trends

Consistent, standardized report summaries

Improved traceability and audit readiness

UseCase: AI Agent to Automate Payroll Input/Output Reconciliation - CxE T&S Working

Opportunity: We propose building an AI-powered reconciliation agent to automate the comparison of Input, Output, and Import/Supplemental payroll data files. This tool will automatically merge, compare, and flag discrepancies across large datasets and produce clear, auditable reports. Current Challenges:

- Manual and repetitive process using Excel 
- Time-consuming (hours per payroll cycle) 
- High risk of human error 
- Errors may lead to incorrect paychecks, delayed payments, or unprocessed retro entries 
- Discrepancies are often found post-submission or due to customer complaints
BusinessValue:
Expected Benefits:

- Saves 2â€“4 hours of manual work per payroll run 
- Reduces payroll error risk and escalations 
- Improves customer satisfaction and retention 
- Enables proactive resolution vs. reactive response 
- Potential for productization and revenue generation
TargetPersonas: Customer Success & Services,Privacy, Regulatory & Compliance,Implementation Managers

Headlines: Help CX CSMs/Managers/Employees find customized information about SR Numbers, Case Numbers, Customer Account Numbers or AR Numbers on finger tips.

UseCase: Enhance Employee Experience for UKG Pro WFM implementation
Headlines: Enhance Employee Experience for UKG Pro WFM implementation for new or migrating customers
Opportunity:
The idea is to enhance the RPA-based ShadowDB setup process in WFM by integrating AI-powered to intelligently interpret an act on customer comments in ServiceNow (SNOW) tickets. While the SNOW form is pre-filled by automation, customers often continue to share important requirements or corrections via comments. AI will analyze these unstructured inputs to:
â€¢	Extract relevant information,
â€¢	Compare with form values,
â€¢	Automatically suggest or trigger updates,
â€¢	Or respond via an AI agent when needed.
This enables smarter, more adaptive automation that reduces human effort and ensures greater accuracy.
Evidence:
Despite having automated SNOW form submissions, manual intervention is still required due to:
â€¢	Customers entering correct details only in comments, not in form fields.
â€¢	Ongoing conversations in SNOW tickets delaying resolution.
â€¢	Errors or mismatches between structured fields and comment content.
BusinessValue: Reviewing past ticket data shows that many requests had comment-driven corrections or additional inputs, leading to delays and rework. This gap limits the efficiency of existing automation and burdens support teams and save TTL.

BusinessValue: Faster adoption leading to shorter TTM.

Headlines: AI-powered assistant for streamlined UKG Pro Suite release governance and readiness compliance.
Opportunity:
UKG manages a complex and fast-paced release environment across Major, Minor, and Service releases. Adherence to release principles, readiness field governance in Jira, and proactive test/status reporting is critical for delivering high-quality, timely features while minimizing customer disruption.

ReleaseGPT leverages internal artifacts and AI to act as a governance advisor and planning assistant for TPMs, RMs, PMs, and engineering teams. It answers detailed questions on:
Release schedules and milestone timelines, Governance processes like exceptions and PKTs, Jira field hygiene and ownership across pillars, Toggle management and testing coordination, Readiness gaps using Pro Suite audit and status data.
This use case significantly reduces manual coordination, ensures compliance with established practices (as outlined in the Release Principles), and allows teams to plan with confidence and speed.
Evidence:
We found operational challenges by collecting user feedback from 20+ stakeholder interviews across EPIC roles (Product, TPM, Engineering, RMs, Enablement). We identified these core challenges throughout the release process:

Release Calendar Management: Current UI is overwhelming and lacks clear integration of key milestones such as branch lock (HCM), code freeze (WFM), PKT dates, and tenant-specific deployment timelines.

Process Complexity: Difficulty understanding and applying fixed vs. release version, toggle strategies, and differences across Service, Minor, and Major release constraints.

Awareness Gaps: Teams are often unaware of process changes, readiness gaps, or org-specific requirements; VAS enablement and WoW outcomes lack integration.

Governance Compliance: Difficulty tracking violations of Release Principles, managing Jira field hygiene, and ensuring toggles/test data are complete.
BusinessValue: ReleaseGPT delivers significant business value to UKG by increasing efficiency, governance, and transparency across the product release lifecycle. It reduces manual effort spent navigating SharePoint, Confluence, Jira, and various dashboards by providing instant, accurate answers to common questions about release schedules, PKT status, toggle configurations, and Jira field compliance. This automation frees up valuable time for TPMs, RMs, and PMs while minimizing the risk of non-compliant or delayed deployments. By proactively flagging governance issuesâ€”such as missing readiness fields or incorrect fix/release versionsâ€”ReleaseGPT enforces alignment with UKGâ€™s Release Principles. It enhances communication between engineering, product, and enablement teams by resolving repetitive process inquiries and making changes or exception paths easier to understand and act upon. Ultimately, ReleaseGPT streamlines coordination, reduces escalations, and supports faster, higher-quality releasesâ€”ensuring UKG can scale its product delivery without sacrificing compliance or customer experience.
TargetPersonas: Product Management & Business Analysis,Project & Program Manager,Software Engineering & UI/UX

Together, they give you full-spectrum visibility: descriptive + predictive analytics. Thatâ€™s critical for sourcing, budgeting, and risk planning.
BusinessValue: The business value of SpendSight lies in its ability to turn procurement data into cost control, risk mitigation, and strategic advantage. Bottom line: SpendSightâ„¢ helps reduce costs, avoid surprises, and drive smarter sourcingâ€”powered by AI but grounded in your actual data.

UseCase: KB Article Generation Agent off of word documents for ServiceNow
Headlines: Create an agent that ingest word documents and returns ServiceNow KB article required format
Opportunity: We are analyzing the top Snow Tickets for the products our team supports and manually creating ServiceNow KB articles using the article creation guidelines. Reformatting the resolution steps into the required format is very time consuming. We want to create an agent that will allow us to enter the resolution steps as a prompt and the results will generate the required KB article for us. In the past we were putting resolution steps in sharepoint support documents however we want to move them into KB articles so that we can leverage the Snow search to deflect/triage the Incidents and articles for us.
Evidence: We are spending hours manually reformatting the content from word documents into KB Article required format. We also want to add in "Quality" validation into the prompt to make sure the article step quality is sufficient. Need to build this agent in a tool all team members have access to.
BusinessValue:
*Eliminate unnecessary time spent reformatting resolution steps into KB article format. Spend that time building new products and services.
*Enable Tier 1/2 support team members to independently resolve incidents with little effort/onboarding

UseCase: KB Article Generation Agent off of word documents for Salesforce
Headlines: Create an agent that ingest word documents and returns Salesforce KB article required format
Opportunity: We are analyzing the top cases for the products our team supports and manually creating Salesforce KB articles using the article creation guidelines. Reformatting the resolution steps into the required format is very time consuming. We want to create an agent that will allow us to enter the steps as a prompt and the results will generate the required KB article for us. In the past we were putting resolution steps in sharepoint support documents however we want to move them into KB articles so that we can leverage the Coveo search to deflect/triage the cases and articles for us.
Evidence: We are spending hours manually reformatting the content from word documents into KB Article required format. We also want to add in "Quality" validation into the prompt to make sure the article step quality is sufficient. Most of my team does not have access to Salesforce and having this agent exist in UKG-GPT would allow the entire team to generate the articles with a limited group reviewing/publishing the articles.
BusinessValue:
Eliminate unnecessary time spent reformatting resolution steps into KB article format
Most of my team do not have Salesforce licenses to generate KB articles using Einstein

Headlines: Agent that helps users understand all UKG DB tables, what each is used for, and how they relate to each other to speed up and simplify SQL script creation
Opportunity: A lot of users can benefit from creating SELECT statements in SQL to obtain customer information, whether it be to gather data or to investigate support cases/defects. The sheer number of tables in UKG and what each table is used for, is unknown for most users which blocks or slows them from being self sufficient in gathering data. If a user can describe what they are trying to resolve/look for, then having an agent that can provide the user which tables to look into can be very helpful in creating the right SQL scripts, especially for new U krewers.
Evidence: A lot of times, users such as Product Managers or support want to use SQL to gather data or to help investigate defects. They, however, are not familiar with all the database tables and will have to reach out to another team for assistance. This slows down resolution times and makes it difficult to onboard new members.
BusinessValue: An agent to help understand the business context for each database table can greatly speed up the resolution time for defects or support cases. It will also help people be more self sufficient in gathering data, which then frees up our more experienced teams to focus on other critical items.
TargetPersonas: Customer Success & Services,Software Engineering & UI/UX,Data and Analytics,Product Management & Business Analysis,Project & Program Manager,U Krewer,Business Operations, Delivery & Enablement,Learning & Development

Headlines: Tool allows domain teams that get their data to People Fabric (PF) using the Entity Ingestion Pipeline to verify data integrity

The AI would be provided with the domain's Swagger documented SOR API and to the teams PF logical schema, and set of test tenants.  It would validate the data returned by the SOR API to the SOT data returned from the PF denodo API by comparing the set of primary keys available in both.
Evidence: Teams do not have a standard way to validate data and are asking for one.
BusinessValue: Improves data quality and reduces the time it take to make the data available.

Headlines: Cloud Network request triage

UseCase: Automated Candidate Assessment Score Extraction and Tracking
Headlines: Streamline the engineering hiring process by auto-extracting HackerRank scores from outlook emails and updating candidate records in real-time on our excel spreadsheet
Opportunity:
As a Talent Acquisition Partner supporting the Engineering group at UKG, managing HackerRank assessments is a manual and repetitive task. Each candidate is first sent an assessment, followed by a personal email explaining the requirement. Once the assessment is completed, their scoresâ€”received via Outlookâ€”must be manually reviewed and added to a master Excel tracker.

This process is time-consuming and prone to human error. The opportunity is to use AI-powered automation to:

Automatically detect and extract HackerRank scores from Outlook emails.

Parse the relevant candidate information and scores using natural language processing (NLP).

Populate an Excel or Google Sheet in real time with the extracted results.

Optionally, trigger a follow-up email or status update within your ATS based on pass/fail outcomes.

By automating this workflow, UKG can eliminate unnecessary administrative overhead, reduce errors, and improve the candidate experience by speeding up the hiring process.
Evidence: We have tons of Engineering reqs - it is so time-consuming doing this.
BusinessValue:
Efficiency: Saves recruiters time by eliminating manual score tracking and email tasks.

Speed: Accelerates the hiring process with real-time score updates.

Accuracy: Reduces human error in candidate records.

Scalability: Supports high-volume hiring without adding administrative overhead.

Candidate Experience: Provides faster feedback, improving candidate impressions.

Data Quality: Ensures consistent, audit-ready hiring data.

Brand Impact: Demonstrates innovation in TA processes, attracting top tech talent.

Headlines: A tool to help employees create tailored development plans to support their career goals at UKG
Opportunity: Our employees want development and sometimes don't know where to start. This idea would use resources available to UKrewers (global career framework, performance reviews, feedback from peers and manager, etc.) to help guide them through building an individual development plan.
Evidence: Individual development plans are a part of our UKG Talent Strategy and are discussed every year at performance review time. It also comes up consistently in our UKX and GPTW surveys that people crave development. Since an employee owns their own career development, helping them create a development plan with a lower bar to entry could result in happier and more successful employees.
BusinessValue: Employees who are working on development are more engaged, and are upskilling themselves to be more valuable to the company.

Headlines: Faster code reviews for standard deployments
Opportunity: AI designed to follow approval criteria in order to approve standard pull requests for our IAC egress changes.
Evidence: GSRA has limited resources to review IAC changes - this agent is designed to review pull requests and determine if they meet the standard change requirements.  If so, it preapproves the change within 10 minutes or submission to speed up the process.
BusinessValue: Faster egress interfaces, reduced wait time for development teams, enhanced emergency change coverage.

Headlines: Expanding reach, saving development time.
Opportunity: Expand the reach of our Global Security Research and Architecture team to provide preliminary reviews of EPICs and their underlying stories for security concerns.  This is the first iteration of a full security review suite that is being built in order to expedite our security review process and to provide teams with the ability to answer security questions earlier and make adjustments sooner in the development lifecycle.
Evidence: GSRA has a limited number of architects per developer that are able to review changes to our product.  As such, we run the risk of missing changes with high security risk.  This additionally gives our teams security information sooner in order to adjust earlier.
BusinessValue: Saves time on security reviews which leads to a faster deployment while also covering more security concerns than the old process.

UseCase: AI-Powered Natural Language Test Automation with Self-Healing Eecution and Auto-Reporting
Headlines: UI Testing with AI-Driven, Zero-Code Automation and Instant Reporting
Opportunity: AI interprets human-like test steps and converts them into actionable UI interactions automatically, reducing the need for hardcode scripts.
Evidence: AI based test automation reduce cost, time and skill dependency
BusinessValue: AI powered UI test automation reduce QA costs and efforts by upto 70% while accelerating time-to-live through natural language-driven resilient testing. It empowers non-technical teams, boosts test coverage and deliver faster.
TargetPersonas: Software Engineering & UI/UX,Product Management & Business Analysis

UseCase: AI-Based Validation of Employee Photo Uploads
Headlines: Use AI to automatically validate uploaded images for proper employee headshot compliance.
Opportunity:
The idea is to integrate an AI-based image classification and validation model into the Employee Photo Upload process in UKG Pro. The model would automatically analyze uploaded images to confirm they meet defined standards for employee headshots. This includes checks such as:

Is the file an image?

Does the image contain a human face?

Is the face clearly visible, unobstructed, and properly centered?

Is there only one face in the image?

Is the background and lighting appropriate (e.g., not a group photo, meme, or unrelated scenery)?

By using AI (such as a computer vision model via an image upload API), the system can flag improper submissions in real-time, reducing manual review, improving user experience, and ensuring consistency across the enterprise. It can also provide user feedback to help correct image issues before final submission.

This capability is especially beneficial during onboarding or mass photo collection events, and aligns well with compliance, professionalism, and system uniformity objectives.

see my demo video here:
https://ukginc-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/g/personal/karel_bertin_ukg_com/EQJJU7QMTItJrr_nDmiSvK8Bm6wt3Tx5XlxMWHwsC0u7kQ?e=aRGlNB&nav=eyJyZWZlcnJhbEluZm8iOnsicmVmZXJyYWxBcHAiOiJTdHJlYW1XZWJBcHAiLCJyZWZlcnJhbFZpZXciOiJTaGFyZURpYWxvZy1MaW5rIiwicmVmZXJyYWxBcHBQbGF0Zm9ybSI6IldlYiIsInJlZmVycmFsTW9kZSI6InZpZXcifX0%3D
Evidence:
Currently, the Employee Photo Upload process lacks automated validation, resulting in frequent issues such as:

Uploads of incorrect file types (e.g., PDFs, screenshots, documents).

Photos that do not contain faces or contain multiple people.

Poor quality or unprofessional images (e.g., dark, blurry, or overly casual).

Users uploading logos, cartoons, or placeholder images instead of actual photos.

These errors require manual intervention by HR teams, leading to inconsistent photo standards, rework, and administrative delays â€” especially during large-scale onboarding or system-wide photo updates.

Customer feedback and internal audit findings have highlighted this as a recurring friction point, affecting both user experience and downstream systems that rely on accurate photos (e.g., badges, org charts, employee profiles).
BusinessValue:
Integrating AI-driven image validation offers clear business value to UKG and our customers:

Improved Data Quality: Ensures only valid, professional headshots are stored in the system, reducing cleanup efforts.

Operational Efficiency: Automates photo screening, significantly reducing HR workload and time spent on manual reviews.

Enhanced User Experience: Real-time feedback allows users to correct issues immediately, minimizing frustration and support tickets.

Scalability: Supports large onboarding cycles or bulk updates without degrading data standards.

Brand Consistency: Helps maintain a unified and professional appearance across internal tools, organizational directories, and customer-facing portals.

Market Differentiator: Positions UKG Pro as a smart, modern platform that leverages AI to solve real-world admin problems.

This AI enhancement aligns with UKGâ€™s vision to create smarter, more efficient HR technology that empowers people and elevates the user experience.

Headlines: Pendo Feedback Classification involves categorizing product feedback to understand user needs and prioritize development efforts
Opportunity: Using AI to categorize the user feedback
Evidence: There were no solution to classify/categorize user feedback collected in Pendo
BusinessValue: Help product managers and ux/ui designer understand user needs and prioritize development efforts
TargetPersonas: Product Management & Business Analysis,Software Engineering & UI/UX

Headlines: Identify and Resolve bad state scenarios within the App
Opportunity:
We have seen in the past how difficult it is to fix some bad state scenarios in the mobile app like blank white screen. Since our app is a hybrid one, there's always a case where the web view didn't load when the app transitions from background. This particular white screen issue is completely sporadic and despite adding many logs, we have seen it coming back time and again. 


I competed a P.O.C leveraging a native iOS model (ImageClassifier), and trained it with 2 sets of data -  NormalScreen and WhiteScreen. 


I imported that model into our app, and using iOS CoreML framework, I was able to successfully find the white screen cases. 
As you see in the confluence page link , there are 2 videos- 

https://engconf.int.kronos.com/spaces/UKGSE/pages/961498498/Spike+-+AI+-+Create+ML+-+ImageClassifier

In the first video, I deliberately set a white screen issue when the app transforms from the background to foreground, and the model was able to predict it and take the user back to the login screen. 

Second video shows how simple all these are to have it in our app. 

Since all these are native, latency should not be of concern, and it can work offline too. Being on device model protects privacy and guards from any other security concerns.
White screen issue is just one of the many bad state that our app can get into. 

We can train our model to detect following use case scenarios - 

    1) Continuous spinner UI display
    2) Home page loading issue 
    3) Menu items not showing as expected
    4) Shortcuts not being available on the dashboard
Evidence:
Issues like blank white screen and persistent spinner display have been a constant problem, and we have recevied many production support tickets. 
This along with other concerns regarding Dashboard Shortcuts needs to be addressed
BusinessValue:
We will be able to identify when the app gets into a bad state, and act on it accordingly. All issues will hook into our alert monitoring system and notify the dev team. We don't have to wait for a prod support call. 

Based on the issue, we can provide automated solutions. For instance, if the app gets into a blank white screen mode when it gets transitioned from background state, we can trigger a sign out call, and put the app back to the very first page. 
If the dashboard shortcuts are not available, we can convey the user with a friendly message.

UseCase: UKG PRO WFM Live Customers Process Build to Migrate to Unified Business Structure or Onestream
Headlines: UKGPro WFM Customers Confusion Remedied and System Unification Optimized
Opportunity: Currently early adopters of the Pro WFM Suite (early adopters of both Pro Pay and People Center and Pro WFM) have a legacy transmission of data between systems.   Transitioning to a new business structure and integration requires a re implementation or Services Request.   Can AI make a bridge for customers to arrive at a more organzied solution without additional cost?
Evidence: Multiple customers have expressed frustration with new features only being applicable to new customers.   Confusion arises when new features are not applivable to existing customers
BusinessValue: Increased Customer Satisfaction and Retention.   A better user experience for UKG admins, HR teams, and end users as it applies to accessing the system.

UseCase: AI curated Dynamic Feature Ownership Roster for Internal Teams
Headlines: For internal usage only - a dynamically curated list of Feature or Tooling team contacts to make research/analysis/troubleshooting extremely time efficient.
Opportunity:
As a member of CIRT - Customer Implementation and Readiness Team, it has been challenging to locate appropriate Engineering and Product teams who own certain features or infrastructure/tooling to be able to expand our Centralized Automated Test suite in a way that allows us to ensure any and all critical features/ integrations are validated for prompt functional behavior, performance and accessibility prior to releasing to customers.

Headlines: Customer Escalation Assistant
Opportunity:
I use ChatGPT to help me analyze data from customers' case and Service Request (SR) histories, allowing me to summarize common issue themes. This analysis helps me prepare more effectively for customer calls and identify ways to provide better support.

What started as a reactionary tool for handling escalations has shown great potential as a proactive strategy. I believe this approach could be highly valuable for Customer Success Managers and Customer Account Managers. By gaining a clear view of the types of issues their customers are submitting to support, they can anticipate needs and take preventive action.

For example, recurring themes in support cases could highlight areas where customers may benefit from targeted training or access to specific documentation. Leveraging this insight proactively would not only improve the customer experience but also reduce the volume of support cases over time.

I have recorded a short 3-minute video walking through this process that I can share as a visual sample for peers or anyone interested.  https://ukginc-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/g/personal/carlos_laya_ukg_com/EaxuPVzHB8JAuLhCM_OIlcgBHPECgLMHMQHV5yNdaax7uA
Evidence: To help CX UKrewers address customer issues
BusinessValue: Address customer issues during escalations and even in a proactive manner,  leveraging Ai tools saves us a lot of time in gathering and analysing the customer's data to come up with trending issues or pain points from the customer based on their support cases.
TargetPersonas: Customer Success & Services,Business Operations, Delivery & Enablement,Privacy, Regulatory & Compliance,Data and Analytics,Product Management & Business Analysis,Project & Program Manager,Software Engineering & UI/UX,U Krewer,People Leaders

Headlines: Automated Workflow to Streamline Competitive Briefs Following CI Leader Outreach
Opportunity:
Each week, the Competitive & Market Intelligence (CMI) team curates and distributes competitive briefs to senior leaders, highlighting key market trends and competitor movements with UKG-relevant points of view. These briefs serve as a one-stop shop for external insights. Following distribution, the briefs are manually uploaded as PDFs to our SharePoint, tagged with metadata, and cataloged in an Excel tracker for reference.cataloging in our excel file where we track. Explained below is our step by step outline of the workflow:

For each weekly Brief: 

CMI Analysts to add topics to draft throughout week and complete draft content ideally by Tuesday afternoon.  

Amy conducts first-level editorial review ahead of group read-out. 

All authors meet for final review with Terry on Wednesday morning.  
 

Once complete, on Wednesday/Thursday:  

Terry distributes via email to distribution list. See list: ALL CI DISTRO.xlsx 

Prepare Brief for upload: remove any comments and double check formatting/spelling, confirm all headlines are captured.  

Download Brief as a PDF and rename using naming convention â€œCompetitive Brief YYYY-MM-DD" 

Upload PDF into â€œFinal Copiesâ€ folder in CI Drive; also move original Word document draft into this folder 

Upload to CI SharePoint under â€œAll Competitive Contentâ€, tagging relevant fields (Competitors, Source = News/Earnings, Category = UKG Produced Content, Date, Content Type = UKG CI Content). 

Amy captures all relevant info in CMI Brief Catalog 

Amy initiates new draft of weekly brief using template. Save new copy of template to folder using naming convention: â€œYYYY-MM-DD Competitive Brief.â€ Tell Analysts in CMI Team chat that draft document is available. 

CMI Analysts post any relevant information in CMI Support Channels (by segment).
Evidence: Lack of efficency due to manual processes and need more scalability as volume of intelligence grows and more and more people look forward to our briefs.
BusinessValue: Stronger Executive Alignment, Increased efficiency, improved responses, scalability and consistency
TargetPersonas: Customer Success & Services,People Leaders,Sales / Marketing Agents

It ensures that each candidate is evaluated based on the most pertinent criteria, aligned with both the jobâ€™s requirements and their unique experience.

AI dynamically adapts questions in real time, accounting for resume nuances such as skills, achievements, and career progression. This not only saves recruiters time but also standardizes and elevates the screening process, reducing bias and improving candidate engagement. The solution can be integrated with applicant tracking systems (ATS) or used as a standalone module in digital hiring workflows. UseCase: Supplier Lens - A Contract Intelligence Assistanct
Headlines: Supplier Lens: Contract Intelligence at Speed and Scale
Opportunity:
UKG manages hundreds of suppliers, contracts, audits, and renewal timelines across a sprawling enterprise. But validating key terms, identifying risks, and ensuring data consistency across contracts, spend reports, and supplier profiles is still manual, fragmented, and slow.
This GPT unlocks a smarter path forward. Supplier Lens automates contract intelligence, surfacing structured supplier profiles, risk indicators, and audit-readiness insights in real time â€” simply by uploading procurement documents and asking natural questions.

This is a more advance version of the Procurement AI tool launched last year in a different platform.
Evidence:
âœ… Volume of Data: Legal and sourcing teams are buried under hundreds of supplier documents, many poorly tagged or inconsistent.

âœ… Manual Risk Checks: Validating auto-renewals, payment terms, and true-ups is labor-intensive and error-prone.

âœ… Missed Renewal Triggers: Gaps in metadata and profile alignment lead to missed escalations or manual renewals without full risk clarity.

âœ… Audit Pressure: Inconsistent tracking of audit clauses, pricing caps, or exclusivity terms creates compliance vulnerabilities.

âœ… Growing Complexity: Strategic relationships, pricing arrangements, and customer-supplier overlaps demand a smarter lens.

This GPT turns a pain point into a powerhouse â€” delivering instant clarity across fragmented documents

GPT Will Be Used For
Supplier Lens acts as a conversational analyst for procurement, legal, and sourcing teams. It will be used to:

Extract key terms from unstructured and structured files â€” contracts, SOWs, audit logs, spend summaries, and supplier profiles.

Build standardized Supplier Profiles including:

Contract status, dates, auto-renewal terms

Payment terms, true-up clauses, audit rights

Spend and committed values

Risk flags for missing or conflicting info

Cross-reference data across multiple sources (contract > profile > spend) to fill in gaps or expose discrepancies.

Identify red/yellow/green flags for missing fields, outdated profiles, or contradictions.

Support proactive renewals and audits by generating ready-to-export profiles and dashboards.

Example prompts:

â€œBuild a profile for Vendor X.â€
â€œWhat are the risks in this MSA?â€
â€œWhich contracts auto-renew in Q4?â€
â€œHighlight suppliers with missing audit rights.â€
BusinessValue:
ðŸš€ Speed & Efficiency
Reduces contract review cycles from hours to minutes.

Enables analysts to focus on negotiation, not metadata extraction.

ðŸ§  Intelligence & Risk Mitigation
Flags outdated, incomplete, or conflicting supplier data.

Surfaces contract-critical terms (e.g., auto-renewal or true-ups) often missed in manual review.

ðŸ“ˆ Executive Visibility
Structured outputs can feed dashboards, audit logs, or renewal planning reports.

Supports strategic sourcing by spotlighting key vendors and risks.

ðŸ”„ Cross-File Consistency
Ensures that contracts, profiles, and spend data align â€” or clearly show where they donâ€™t.

Reinforces audit-readiness with explainable logic and document trail traceability.

ðŸ”’ Compliance & Governance
Red/yellow/green flag logic builds accountability and supports escalations.

Prioritizes the most authoritative source when conflicts arise.

UseCase: From User Story to Git Commit: Closing the Loop with AI
Headlines: AI-Powered Agents Deliver Real-Time Insight into What We Build and Why
Opportunity:
Weâ€™re initiating a phased strategy to modernize how BSAs, developers, and QAs collaborate â€” reducing manual documentation and increasing traceability through AI integration.

Phase One (POC):
Weâ€™re piloting Modern Requirements, an AI-powered tool integrated with Azure DevOps. It enables BSAs to work directly in ADO, where documentation (BRDs, FDDs, TDDs) is automatically updated and maintained â€” eliminating redundant effort.

End-to-End Vision:
Unified Documentation
Living documents in Azure DevOps replace static Word files, ensuring real-time updates across teams.

Traceable Design & Code Decisions
Business user stories are directly linked to design and development decisions. AI agents will surface why specific designs or code paths were chosen â€” factoring in current architecture and existing codebases.

Code Visibility
GitHub pull requests are automatically linked to ADO work items, providing full traceability from requirement to implementation.

Automated QA
Test scripts are generated via Modern Requirements CoPilot, accelerating validation and reducing manual QA effort.

AI-Powered Knowledge Retrieval
Long-term, personal AI agents will retrieve historical context on how and why systems were built â€” improving onboarding, audits, and change impact analysis.

This initiative builds on our strong Microsoft ecosystem (Azure DevOps, GitHub, Office 365) and positions us to scale AI-driven productivity across the SDLC.
Evidence:
Outdated Documentation Creates Risk
Many BRDs, FDDs, and TDDs live in SharePoint and are no longer current. As systems evolve, these static documents fall out of sync â€” leading to confusion, rework, and missed requirements.

Organizational Change Has Accelerated
Teams have restructured, roles have shifted, and responsibilities have changed. Without a centralized, living source of truth, critical knowledge is lost or siloed.

Loss of Institutional Knowledge
As experienced team members leave, so does the context behind design and code decisions. New team members struggle to understand why something was built a certain way â€” slowing onboarding and increasing the risk of misaligned changes.

Manual Processes Are Inefficient
BSAs and developers spend significant time duplicating effort across Word, Excel, Azure DevOps, and GitHub. This fragmentation leads to version control issues and inconsistent documentation.

AI Can Bridge the Gaps
Tools like Modern Requirements and CoPilot for DevOps can:

Maintain living documents directly in Azure DevOps
Link business stories to design/code decisions
Surface historical rationale and related code
Auto-generate test scripts for QA

Weâ€™re Positioned to Move Fast
Our existing Microsoft ecosystem (Azure DevOps, GitHub, Office 365) gives us a strong foundation to scale AI-driven automation with minimal disruption.
BusinessValue:
Increased Delivery Speed
Automating documentation and traceability reduces manual effort, enabling faster handoffs between BSAs, developers, and QAs â€” accelerating time-to-market for new features.

Improved Quality and Consistency
Living documents and AI-generated test scripts reduce human error, ensure alignment across teams, and improve the overall quality of deliverables.

Enhanced Traceability and Compliance
Full visibility from user story to code and test case supports better audit readiness, change impact analysis, and regulatory compliance.

Reduced Knowledge Loss
AI agents preserve institutional knowledge by capturing the why behind design and code decisions â€” critical in a dynamic environment with team restructuring and turnover.

Lower Operational Costs
By reducing rework, manual documentation, and onboarding time, UKG can reallocate resources to higher-value activities and innovation.

Strategic Use of Existing Investments
This initiative builds on UKGâ€™s existing Microsoft ecosystem (Azure DevOps, GitHub, Office 365), maximizing ROI without requiring new platforms.

Future-Ready Foundation
Establishes a scalable framework for AI-driven development, positioning UKG to adopt emerging technologies like autonomous agents and predictive analytics.
TargetPersonas: Business Operations, Delivery & Enablement,Help Desk Support and Incident Response

UseCase: Accelerating SQL Development with Schema-Aware AI in SSMS
Headlines: AI-Augmented Data Access: Enabling Faster, Safer, and Smarter SQL Workflows
Opportunity:
We are exploring the use of schema-aware AI, such as Copilot for SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), to enhance how engineers and analysts interact with our SQL databases. These tools go beyond traditional AI assistants by understanding the actual structure of our databasesâ€”tables, relationships, column names, and constraintsâ€”allowing them to generate accurate, context-aware queries.

This capability significantly reduces time spent writing and debugging SQL by suggesting correct syntax, joins, and filters based on the real schema. It also lowers the barrier for less-experienced users to access data safely and correctly, reducing reliance on senior engineers or DBAs for routine reporting and exploration.

By using schema-aware AI, we improve developer productivity, reduce query errors, increase access to data insights, and improve consistency in how data is queried and understood across teams. This unlocks faster decision-making, better collaboration between technical and business users, and more confident use of our enterprise data assets.
Evidence:
Writing efficient, accurate SQL queries requires deep knowledge of database structure, relationships, naming conventions, and business rules. In large or complex environments, this creates several challenges:

High dependency on subject matter experts (e.g., DBAs or senior developers) to assist with query design, schema navigation, and performance tuning

Frequent trial-and-error when writing queries due to unfamiliar schemas, leading to lost time and frustration

Risk of data quality issues caused by incorrect joins, filters, or assumptions about table relationships

Bottlenecks in analytics and reporting, especially for teams that need data access but lack strong SQL skills

Inconsistent query patterns and logic across teams, making it harder to maintain or validate results

Traditional AI tools can help with generic SQL generation but often fail in environments where schema context is criticalâ€”which is almost always the case in enterprise systems.

Schema-aware AI (like Copilot for SSMS) directly addresses this gap by understanding the actual structure of the database in real time. It enables:

Smarter, more accurate query generation

Real-time suggestions that reflect true table relationships and naming conventions

Easier onboarding for new engineers or analysts

Safer, faster access to critical data

A shift from manual effort to guided, intelligent workflows

In short, schema-aware AI can transform how we interact with our dataâ€”improving speed, trust, and accessibility across both technical and non-technical teams.
BusinessValue:
Faster query development by eliminating guesswork around table structures and relationships

Reduced dependency on senior engineers and DBAs for routine data access and reporting

Lower risk of data errors due to AI-generated queries that align with the actual schema

Increased self-service capabilities for analysts and other non-expert users

Shorter onboarding time for new team members who need to work with SQL

More consistent, maintainable SQL across teams and projects

Better utilization of data assets for decision-making, powered by quicker access to accurate insights

Improved productivity for engineering and data teams by offloading repetitive query writing tasks
TargetPersonas: Business Operations, Delivery & Enablement,Software Engineering & UI/UX,Data and Analytics,Help Desk Support and Incident Response

Headlines: A way to ensure our data usage aligns with data governance and our contractual commitments

Per his request, we are actively pursuing ways to implement such a tool, and I would really appreciate if someone could reach out to talk more, and review the slide deck.  The level of effort for phase 1 is minimal, as much of the content already exists, and we only need to train and test... so this would be an excellent candidate for a relatively simple, but massively impactful effort, with company-wide visibility and interaction.  Thanks, Doug Krull

BusinessValue: Outstanding employee experience, massive reduction in HR case volume, test lab for integration into UKG-owned tools (revenue opportunity).  Scalable to serve other needs in short order (of which we have many :)

UseCase: Credit & Concession Request Intake Form - Root Cause AI Assistant
Headlines: Improve customer billing escalation process through proper routing
Opportunity: We recently went live with our new Credit & Concession Request (CCR) intake form in Salesforce. This form is used for teams across UKG to submit various types of customer billing escalations, inquiries, credit requests, contract change requests, and termination requests. The routing for these requests is based on the primary, secondary, and tertiary root causes selected by the requestor. A major pain point for the teams responsible for reviewing and responding to these requests is improper routing based on the root causes selected. The root cause options are not always the most intuitive and accuracy is highly dependent on the requestor's level of expertise. The majority of the time, routing should really be based on the type of fee involved in the request (i.e. PEPM subscription fee minimums or overages, Service Requests, Launch Fees, Forms & Print Services, Hardware, etc.), though there are some exceptions to this. We would see major improvements in efficiency and effectiveness if we could ensure requests are routed to the appropriate team upon submission, as opposed to sitting in one backlog just to be re-routed and sitting in another backlog. AI could be utilized to ask some clarifying questions of the user, potentially pull invoice line details to understand the type of fee associated with the request, and help guide the user on which root causes to select to ensure appropriate routing. Additionally, AI could help answering some of the more basic questions or guide the requestor on how they can find the answer themselves.
Evidence: see above
BusinessValue: Increased customer satisfaction with reduced time to respond; reduced administrative effort on the resources involved in reviewing these requests.
TargetPersonas: Business Operations, Delivery & Enablement,Privacy, Regulatory & Compliance,Customer Success & Services,Product Management & Business Analysis,U Krewer,Sales / Marketing Agents

Bob leaves early when on cashier duty 25% of the time but leaves on time or volunteers for OT 50% of the time when on stocking.  Therefore when the availability is there schedule bob on eve or afternoons stocking.  Currently availability and need is taken into account but not attendance history.
Evidence: This would likely increase employee satisfaction and overall customer experience.  Currently the only way to do this would be for managers to manually detect patterns.
BusinessValue: Increased client adoption in the retail environment as we would have a differntiating ability to schedule not just to need and budget but incorporating employee subjective preferences.  Market Share, differentiation in a crowded market, brand application (our purpose is people)
